title: What side did Czechoslovakia fight on in WWII? - Quora

response.answer_text: What side… well, you have to specify which time you are talking about. Czechoslovakia under this name fought on the victorious side of the allies only. It had a government (led by President Dr Edvard Beneš and PM Jan Šrámek – there were two different governments; the government-in-exile was first created in late 1939 in Paris) which had to govern from London because some criminals were temporarily in control of the Czechoslovak territory. The military activities included the management of 2500 Czechoslovak pilots who were fighting in the British Royal Air Force, just like their Polish counterparts; and the only successful assassination of a top Nazi official ever, Reinhard Heydrich, i.e. the Operation Anthropoid. Czechoslovakia was also coordinating some resistance activities on the territory controlled by Nazi Germany – which tried to reclassify the territory as the “Sudetengau” plus “Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia” and the formally independent “Slovak State”. Sadly, the resources that Czechoslovakia controlled up to 1938 or 1939 were mostly exploited by the Nazis up to various moments in 1944–1945. Czechoslovakia was regaining the control over the territory in Spring 1945. In April 1945, the Czechoslovak government (which was free of communists, as far as I know) made an agreement with the Czech and Slovak communists about the post-war evolution of Czechoslovakia by signing the Košice Program in Eastern Slovakia.

Czechoslovakia had been dismembered shortly before the start of WWII. Large areas had been handed over to Germany and the rest of the Czech lands were seized by Germany in March 1939. Slovakia was turned into German satellite state and part of it had been annexed by Hungary. By the start of WWII Czechoslovakia did not exist as a state. However, a number of Czechs and Slovaks managed to reach London, where they headed a small Free Czechoslovak Army.
